inclusion.criterion: FEV1</= 70% and FEV1/FVC </= 70% predicted from age, height and sex
inclusion.label: not_met
inclusion.evidence: Spirometry was performed revealing a forced expiratory volume in the first second (FEV1) of 63% of the predicted

inclusion.criterion: No documented episode of AECB (requiring treatment) within 6 weeks of randomization
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: and not experiencing an exacerbation at the time of screening
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Sputum production on most days, even when exacerbation free
inclusion.label: not_met

inclusion.criterion: Subjects presented with at least two documented (i.e. requiring antibiotics and/or systemic steroid administration) acute exacerbation episodes during the last 12 months
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: If receiving chronic therapy with inhaled long acting bronchodilators and/or inhaled or systemic steroids, the treatment must have remained stable for the preceding 6 weeks prior to screening
inclusion.label: not_met

inclusion.criterion: Smoking history of at least 20 pack-years
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: He doesn't smoke or use illicit drugs

inclusion.criterion: Subjects willing and able to give fully informed written consent
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Known bronchial carcinoma, pulmonary tuberculosis, cystic fibrosis, documented chronic bronchial asthma or diffuse bronchiectasis
exclusion.label: triggers
exclusion.evidence: He is a chef with a history of asthma for 3 years, suffering from frequent cough, wheezing, and shortness of breath and chest tightness

exclusion.criterion: Subjects who are actively participating in intensive pulmonary rehabilitation programs
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Subjects with a known history of chronic colonization of pathogenic organisms resistant to moxifloxacin, e.g. Pseudomonas spp, MRSA
exclusion.label: triggers
exclusion.evidence: He doesn't smoke or use illicit drugs

exclusion.criterion: No systemic or inhaled antibiotic therapy during the 6 weeks prior to screening and any long term antibiotic usage
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Subjects requiring home ventilatory support for COPD and those who have a tracheostomy in situ (subjects requiring home/potable oxygen therapy or CPAP for sleep apnea can be included)
exclusion.label: triggers

notes: The patient has a history of asthma, but the symptoms become more bothersome within 1-2 hours of starting work every day and worsen throughout the work week. He currently uses inhaled corticosteroid (ICS) and fluticasone 500 mcg/salmeterol 50 mcg.
